channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: U.S. crude oil jumps as Biden comments on possible Israel retaliation on Iran
item.description: Supply disruptions increase as fighting in the Middle East intensifies, according to analysts.

item.title: Digital bank Revolut slams Meta over approach to scams, says tech giant should compensate victims
item.description: British fintech Revolut criticized Meta over its approach to tackling fraud and said the U.S. tech giant should directly compensate fraud victims.

item.title: Sterling plunges more than 1% against the dollar, euro after Bank of England governor's comments on rates
item.description: Sterling was down 1.27% to $1.3098 at 12:30 p.m. in London.

item.title: European markets close 1% lower as investors focus on Middle East escalation
item.description: European stocks closed lower Thursday as conflict in the Middle East weighed on regional investor sentiment.

item.title: Klarna CEO says a European tech brain drain is ‘number one risk’ for company ahead of IPO
item.description: Klarna boss Sebastian Siemiatkowski said unfavorable share-based compensation rules in Europe could cause employees to flock to U.S. tech companies.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The 'sticky' outsourcing firms on the rise
item.description: Inside India looks at the growing trend in outsourcing research and development to India, and how India will fabricate its first microchip in two years.

item.title: UK house sales rise since the Covid-19 boom as lower mortgage rates spur activity
item.description: Lower mortgage rates are sparking an uptick in the U.K. housing market, with home sales rising last month at the fastest pace since the post-lockdown boom, new data shows.

item.title: Young Chinese are 'retiring' in the countryside as China's unemployment woes grate
item.description: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.

item.title: A private island for $1,000 per night — for those who are willing to get there
item.description: Pinang Island is a rustic eco-resort that opened two years ago in Indonesia. But traveling to the remote island often requires three flights and a boat ride.

item.title: OpenAI gets $4 billion revolving credit line, giving it more than $10 billion in liquidity
item.description: On top of its latest funding round, OpenAI has put a $4 billion revolving credit line in place — bringing its total liquidity to more than $10 billion.

item.title: Auto giants are getting nervous about the prospect of mega fines as EV demand falters
item.description: Europe's top car giants appear to be increasingly concerned about the prospect of massive fines, particularly as electric vehicle demand falters.

item.title: Biden administration can move forward with student loan forgiveness, federal judge rules
item.description: A federal judge will let expire a temporary restraining order against the Biden administration's sweeping new student loan forgiveness plan.

item.title: Hong Kong snaps six-day winning streak as China stimulus rally fizzles
item.description: Markets in mainland China will remain closed until Oct. 8 for a week-long holiday and South Korea will be shut Thursday for National Foundation Day.

item.title: Japan still expected to stick to hiking cycle despite PM Ishiba's dovish turn
item.description: Japanese currency experts are not budging from their Bank of Japan rate policy expectations even as the yen falls.

item.title: U.S. bans Chinese firms in Uyghur region as Beijing fights forced labor claims
item.description: The U.S. has added two new Chinese companies to Xinjiang trade blacklist one week after Beijing launched a retaliation against forced labor claims.

item.title: The East and Gulf coast ports strike could be a no-win situation for the Biden administration
item.description: President Biden is sticking to his position of not forcing striking port union workers back on the job, a political call that adds uncertainty to inflation.

item.title: China stock ETFs rip higher even as mainland markets close for holiday
item.description: Exchange-traded funds overseas that track Chinese stocks continued their rally Wednesday even as mainland markets were shut for a week-long holiday.

item.title: I grew my side hustle into a $20,000 a month business — here are 4 tips I have for aspiring entrepreneurs
item.description: Jean Kang, 32, quit her decade-long career in tech to go all-in on her side hustle. Since February, her business has brought in about $160,000.

item.title: Israel retaliation may target Iran oil infrastructure, boosting prices further, Wall Street analysts say
item.description: For months, traders have largely dismissed the risk of a supply disruption in the Middle East, but the threat is growing.

item.title: Tesla stock slips after EV maker misses estimates on deliveries
item.description: Tesla's third-quarter deliveries report follows a rally in the stock price over the past few months.

item.title: Mining giant Fortescue says it's time to walk away from the 'proven fantasy' of net zero
item.description: Fortescue, the world's fourth-largest iron ore miner, has outlined plans to stop burning fossil fuels across its Australian iron ore operations by 2030.

item.title: After a decade of Elon Musk promising Tesla robotaxis, here’s what we know
item.description: Elon Musk has spent a decade promising to turn Teslas into robotaxis. CNBC explores whether the company is ready to pivot to autonomy.

item.title: Costco adds platinum bars to its precious metals lineup
item.description: Gold bars launched at Costco in August 2023, and not even two months later were selling out within hours of a restock.

item.title: Yale's Stephen Roach: Markets are in danger of being 'whipsawed' by Middle East conflict, U.S. unemployment
item.description: "We are likely to see significant increases in volatility and markets that really are whipped back and forth dramatically," Roach told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia."

item.title: China says it filed an appeal to WTO over Canada's tariffs on EVs and metals
item.description: Canada announced in August that it would impose 100% import tariffs on China-made EVs.

item.title: OpenAI closes funding at $157 billion valuation, as Microsoft, Nvidia, SoftBank join round
item.description: OpenAI closed its long-awaited funding round, announcing that it raised $6.6 billion at a $157 billion post-money valuation.

item.title: Oil watchers now see a real threat of supply disruptions after latest Iran-Israel escalation
item.description: Oil watchers are now factoring in a genuine threat to crude supplies after Iran launched a barrage of missiles on Israel.

item.title: As Netanyahu vows Iran payback, markets watch for dangers of further escalation
item.description: Markets are braced for a potential Israeli response after Tehran's missile attack, with up to 4% of global oil supply at risk if Iran's infrastructure is hit.

item.title: European markets close mixed on Middle East tensions; defense stocks rally
item.description: European stocks closed mixed on Wednesday as investors assessed the ongoing conflict in the Middle East.

item.title: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing team sues NASCAR and CEO Jim France
item.description: Michael Jordan's racing team and fellow team Front Row Motorsports said NASCAR has used anticompetitive practices to prevent fair compensation in the sport.
